info.title: RozetkaPay payment API specification
info.description: # Introduction **RozetkaPay API** enables you to integrate online payments into your platform, providing a seamless and secure transaction experience for your users. # Basic information ## Authorization Main type of authorization is [BasicAuth](#section/Authentication/BasicAuth) which is always required. To perform payment requests on behalf of another login, you have to provide it in [onBehalfOf](#section/Authentication/onBehalfOf) header. If you would like to receive customer's information with RID auth token - add [customerAuth](#section/Authentication/customerAuth) to your request. ## Rate Limits RozetkaPay applies rate limit for its APIs. API client should handle rate limiting gracefully. It is recommended to watch for 429 status codes and build in a retry mechanism with an exponential backoff schedule. Some randomness could be added into the backoff to avoid a [thundering herd effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thundering_herd_problem). X-RATELIMIT-RESET header (time in seconds, after which requests are allowed again) could be used as a basis for retry mechanism. Example of headers for 1000 requests/second rate limit (after first request): Header field name | Description | Example ------------------------ | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------ `X-RATELIMIT-LIMIT` | `Allowed requests per second` | `X-RATELIMIT-LIMIT: 1000` `X-RATELIMIT-RESET` | `Time to reset in seconds` | `X-RATELIMIT-RESET: 0` `X-RATELIMIT-REMAINING` | `Number of left requests` | `X-RATELIMIT-REMAINING: 999` ## Callbacks A callback is considered successful when the receiving endpoint returns an HTTP 200 status code. All other status codes are treated as a failure. If a status code other than 200 is received, the system will attempt to resend the callback at predefined intervals. ### Source verification Each callback sent by RozetkaPay is signed using the merchant's password used for the payment operation. The signature is included with the callback and can be found in the `X-ROZETKAPAY-SIGNATURE` header. This header allows you to verify that the callback is from RozetkaPay. #### Calculation algorithm: ``` signature=base64url_encode(sha1($password + base64url_encode($json_body) + $password)) ``` #### Example of signature calculation in python ```python import base64 import hashlib def webhook_signature(password: str, data: str, encoding: str = 'UTF-8') -> str: """ Generate a webhook signature for verification. Args: password (str): Password used for the payment operation. data (str): String representation of the callback content. encoding (str, optional): Encoding to be used. Defaults to 'UTF-8'. Returns: str: Generated signature. """ base64_data = base64.urlsafe_b64encode(data.encode(encoding)).decode(encoding) signature_data = password + base64_data + password signature = base64.urlsafe_b64encode( hashlib.sha1(signature_data.encode(encoding)).digest() ).decode(encoding) return signature # Body received from callback callback_body = '{"name": "john", "age": 21}' # Result signature print(webhook_signature('your_password', callback_body)) ``` **Note:** Do not remove the `=` padding during base64 URL-safe encoding, or the signature will be incorrectly calculated. # Apple Pay & Google Pay If you wish to provide your customers a better experience, we support online payments with Apple Pay & Google Pay. You have two options to integrate those payment methods: 1. Via our checkout (this way you only have to ask for the feature, and the buttons will appear to customers). Refer to [Create payment](#operation/createPayment) operation for details. 2. Embedding button into your website or mobile application - this requires some additional steps from you to generate Apple/Google Pay tokens and pass it to us via [Create payment](#operation/createPayment) operation. ## Apple Pay To add the **Apple Pay** entitlement to your website or mobile application, you need to have: - An [Apple Developer account](https://developer.apple.com) that is associated with either the [Apple Developer Program](https://developer.apple.com/programs/), or the [Apple Developer Enterprise Program](https://developer.apple.com/programs/enterprise/). - An individual [Merchant ID](https://help.apple.com/developer-account/#/devb2e62b839?sub=devf31990e3f) that identifies you to Apple Pay as a merchant who is able to accept payments. - [Brand guidelines](https://developer.apple.com/apple-pay/marketing/) reviewed and accepted. To integrate Apple Pay to your **mobile application**, [follow the instruction](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/passkit/apple_pay). To integrate Apple Pay to your **website**, [follow the instruction](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_pay_on_the_web/apple_pay_js_api). After you completed the integration with Apple Pay for any of your environment (mobile or web), you should receive the following kind of JSON object as a result of Apple Pay call: ```shell { "version": "EC_v1", "data": "zTMZDPumdE7h8oY/+31VMZd60dMaxB...", "signature": "MIAGCSqGSIb3DQEHA...", "header": { "ephemeralPublicKey": "MFkwEwYHKoZIzj0C...", "publicKeyHash": "3AKqH/wPWdQIBpGIv1PC4uDTbGouPgWbmUlFGiHopig=", "transactionId": "d6e63976191fdf051f7cb95e0e5da70a19c99a5576ececbfc0fd65ad2a7f2f74" } } ``` This payload should be encoded to [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) and passed in `customer.payment_method.apple_pay.token` field on [Create payment](#operation/createPayment) operation. ## Google Pay Firstly please review the following documentation in order to get familiar with the integration process: - API documentation [for mobile application](https://developers.google.com/pay/api/android) and [for website](https://developers.google.com/pay/api/web) - Brand guidelines [for mobile application](https://developers.google.com/pay/api/android/guides/brand-guidelines) and [for website](https://developers.google.com/pay/api/web/guides/brand-guidelines) The `gateway` parameter in the script should have the constant value of `evopay`. The value of the `gatewayMerchantId` parameter should be a unique identifier which can be provided via our Support team. In response, Google shall return the `PaymentData` item, and the field `paymentMethodData.tokenizationData.token` shall contain a safely encrypted Google Pay Token (a string of characters). This string should be encoded to [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) and passed in `customer.payment_method.google_pay.token` field on [Create payment](#operation/createPayment) operation. # Widget In order to smoothly collect customer's card details, you have to use our Widget Checkout. It might be embedded into your web page and should provide smooth and secure credit card tokenization flow. ## Integration Include `script` tag into your website: `` The script is loaded asynchronously. ### `init()` method receive parameters: ```js let initParams = { /* Widget key issued by RozetkaPay */ key: 'hQ8aqcm/RG1RF7MaImmzZUsThYhAVDG6R7kazf9+r7zuoWo6', /* Optional amount */ amount: 350.5, /* Currently, only 'inline' mode is supported */ mode: 'inline', /* Optional user language */ lang: 'uk', /* Optional predefined custom style */ style: 'evo', /* Optional widget type */ type: 'full_card', /* Optional customer ip */ customer_ip: '127.0.0.1', /* Optional customer id */ customer_id: '123', /* Optional customer email */ customer_email: 'tom.hanks@example.com', /* Optional customer country */ customer_country: 'UA', /* Optional customer city */ customer_city: 'Kyiv', /* Identifier of HTML element (for 'inline' mode only) */ selector: 'widget-checkout', /* Handler for receiving token data */ onToken: function(tokenData) { /* It is guaranteed that`tokenData` will have the following fields: { "token": "String(<=128)", "expires_at": "ISO-8601 DateTime", "card_mask": "String(13-19)" } */ } }; let widget = RPayCardWidget.init(initParams) ``` ### `RPayCardWidget#init` parameters: Parameter | Type | Required | Description ------------------- | -------- | -------- |------------ `key` | String | ✅ | Widget key issued by RozetkaPay. `mode` | String | ✅ | Should be equal to `inline`. `selector` | String | ✅ | Identifier of HTML element (e.g. `div id={payform-holder}`) where the widget will be mounted (for `inline` mode). `onToken` | Function | ✅ | Callback to invoke when the checkout process is complete. `amount` | Number | | Optional amount to be shown in widget for UX purposes. `locale` | Object | | Locale customization `lang` | String | | Preferred widget localization. Currently supported languages: `en`, `uk`, `pl`. `style` | String | | Optional predefined custom style `type` | String | | Optional widget type. Available options: `full_card`(default) - collect all card credentials (payments), `pan_only` - tokenize only card number (payouts). `template` | String | | Optional custom template. Currently supported templates: `line` `customer_ip` | String | | Optional customer [IP address](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_address). `customer_id` | String | | Optional customer identifier in merchant's system (required in case of External tokenization). `customer_email` | String | | Optional customer email (required in case of External tokenization). `customer_country` | String | | Optional customer country. `customer_city` | String | | Optional customer city. `locale` | Object | | Optional object to set text for widget elements. ### `locale` object example ```json { "uk": { "cardNumber": "Номер карти", "expiryDate": "Строк дії", "cvv": "CVV", "submit": "Сплатити", "yy": "ГГ", "mm": "ММ", "hints": { "cvvHint": "Код міститься на зворотній стороні карти" }, "errors": { "cardnumber": "Неправильний номер карти", "expiryDate": "Строк дії карти закінчився", "cvv": "Некорректний CVV/CVC2 код" } } } ``` ### `#onToken` parameters: Parameter | Type | Required | Description ----------- | ------------- | -------- |------------ `token` | String(≤128) | ✅ | Token issued by RozetkaPay. Acceptable for payments via `direct` mode. `expires_at` | String(26) | ✅ | ISO-8601 timestamp (`yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`). End of token life. Example: `2099-12-31T00:00:00`. `card_mask` | String(13-19) | ✅ | Mask of tokenized card. Example: `424242******4242`. ## Widget API `RPayCardWidget#init` return special control object with the following API methods: Method | Parameter | Description ----------------|-----------|------------ `widget.open()` | none | Render widget `widget.close()`| none | Force close widget ## Integration examples ### Eager widget loading: ```js // Eagerly initialize widget function __onWidgetReady() { let widget = RPayCardWidget.init({ key: 'hQ8aqcm/RG1RF7MaImmzZUsThYhAVDG6R7kazf9+r7zuoWo6', amount: 350.5, mode: 'inline', lang: 'uk', selector: 'widget-checkout', /* Handler for receiving token data */ onToken: function(tokenData) { /* Handle token data. For example, create direct payment or add card to wallet */ backend.submitPayment(orderId, tokenData); } }); } const payButton = document.getElementById('btn-pay'); // Open widget on action payButton.addEventListener('click', function(e) { e.preventDefault(); widget.open(); }); ``` After internal form submission, RozetkaPay token token will be sent in response to `onToken` function. If script was loaded asynchronously, you should wrap `init()` method in function wrapper: `__onWidgetReady` ### Lazy widget loading ```javascript // Create widget entity on button click (for example, radio button option) function __onWidgetReady() { document .getElementById('btn-pay') .addEventListener('click', function(e) { e.preventDefault(); RPayCardWidget .init({ key: 'hQ8aqcm/RG1RF7MaImmzZUsThYhAVDG6R7kazf9+r7zuoWo6', amount: 350.5, mode: 'inline', lang: 'uk', selector: 'widget-checkout', /* Handler for receiving token data */ onToken: function(tokenData) { // Handle token data. For example, create direct payment or add card to wallet. backend.submitToken(orderId, tokenData); } }) .open(); } ); } ``` ### Initialize and open widget instantly ```javascript function __onWidgetReady() { RPayCardWidget.init({ ... }).open(); } ``` ## Widget Events ### Example usage: ```javascript document.addEventListener('widget-init-ready', () => { widget.open(); }) document.addEventListener('widget-init-error', (e) => { console.error('error', e.detail.id, e.detail.message) }); ``` After widget is successfully initiated, `widget-init-ready` event is dispatched. Otherwise, in case of error, widget will dispatch `widget-init-error` error. You can add event listener to this events. # Testing your integrations ## Test cards for Aquiring flow Card number | Expiration date | CVV | 3D Secure | Result --------------------- | ----------------- |-------|-------------|-------------------- 4242 4242 4242 4242 | any | any | yes | success 5454 5454 5454 5454 | any | any | yes | success 4111 1111 1111 1111 | any | any | no | success 5555 5555 5555 4444 | any | any | no | success 4200 0000 0000 0000 | any | any | yes | rejected 5105 1051 0510 5100 | any | any | yes | rejected 4444 3333 2222 1111 | any | any | no | rejected 5100 0000 2000 2000 | any | any | no | rejected 4000 0000 0000 0044 | any | any | no | insufficient-funds ## Test order details for the PayParts flow. This works only with the 'stub' bank and exclusively on the development environment. | Phone number | Confirmation | Result | |------------------|---------------|-----------| | +380930000001 | Webpage | success | | +380930000002 | Webpage | success | | +380930000003 | None | success | | +380930000004 | None | success | | +380930000007 | Webpage | rejected | | +380930000008 | Webpage | rejected | | +380930000009 | None | rejected | | +380930000010 | None | rejected |

post.description:
Creates payment and performs desired operation.
When `mode` is set to `direct` - `customer` field becomes required.
Creates payment and performs desired operation.
Confirm two-step payment.
Cancel two-step payment
Refund one-step payment after withdrawal, or two-step payment after confirmation.

If merchant's balance is not enough to process refund, this refund will be deferred and retried automatically
for some period until it fails for some reason, or balance became enough to process it. If the refund retrying
is timed out, the transaction will became failed with `refund_is_cancelled_by_system` status.
This endpoint allows to retry refund transaction manually if it has pending status.

If merchant's balance is not enough to process refund, this refund will be deferred and retried automatically for some period until it fails or balance became enough to process it. If the refund retrying process is timed out, the transaction will became failed with `refund_is_cancelled_by_system` status. This endpoint allows to cancel refund transaction manually if it has pending status. In this case the status it will be set to `refund_is_cancelled_by_initiator`.

Prepares the data about the specified payment of transaction and sends it into `callback_url` which was provided on the payment step.
If the `operation` field is not provided the callback will be sent for the last operation.

204.description: Payment successfully found and callback wes sent to the URL specified on the payment step

post.description:
Starts card confirmation process that allows to use this card for future operations.
Result of the confirmation will be sent via callback.
When `mode` is set to `direct` - `customer` field becomes required.
Creates batch payment and performs desired operation.
Confirms batch payment and performs desired operation.
Cancels batch payment and performs desired operation.

delete.description:
Deletes customer payment method from wallet.
Either X-CUSTOMER-AUTH header or external_id param is required.

get.description:
Returns customer details including payment methods, if saved.
Either X-CUSTOMER-AUTH header or external_id param is required.

post.description:
Adds new payment method to wallet.
Either X-CUSTOMER-AUTH header or external_id param is required.

get.description:
Returns customer wallet item.
Either X-CUSTOMER-AUTH header or external_id param is required.

Returns confirmation status of the payment method is wallet.
Either X-CUSTOMER-AUTH header or external_id param is required.

parameters.description: id of the payment method in wallet
parameters.name: option_id

get.summary: Get confirmation status of the card in wallet

post.description:
Set default payment method in wallet.
Either X-CUSTOMER-AUTH header or external_id param is required.
Creates a payout request with desired payout type.

parameters.description: Identifier of the transaction in your platform
parameters.name: external_id

get.description:
Returns available and commited balance of the merchant.
Useful to track available funds for payout requests.

post.description: Resends payout callback
Cancels cash payout

Creates order for payparts using one of the available methods.
For now, only the `direct` mode is available.

Common response statuses:
- Status: `success` Status Code: `contract_was_signed_on_client_side` - order was signed on client side, separate confirmation request needed
- Status: `success` Status Code: `transaction_successful` - final success status. Order was confirmed automatically or bank has one stage confirmation
- Status: `pending` Status Code: `pending` - wait for client signing
- Status: `failure` Status Code: any - depends on error

Confirm payparts order

Common response statuses:
- Status: `success` Status Code: `transaction_successful` - payparts order was successfully confirmed
- Status: `failure` Status Code: any - depends on error

Cancel payparts order

Common response statuses:
- Status: `success` Status Code: `cancel_successful` - payparts order was successfully canceled
- Status: `failure` Status Code: any - depends on error

Refund transaction after confirmation.

Common response statuses:
- Status: `success` Status Code: `refund_successful` - payparts installment was successfully refunded
- Status: `pending` Status Code: `pending` - wait for bank refund, final status will be set via callback
- Status: `failure` Status Code: any - depends on error

If merchant's balance is not enough to process refund, this refund will be deferred and retried automatically
for some period until it fails for some reason, or balance became enough to process it. If the refund retrying
is timed out, the transaction will became failed with `refund_is_cancelled_by_system` status.
This endpoint allows to retry refund transaction manually if it has pending status.

If merchant's balance is not enough to process refund, this refund will be deferred and retried automatically for some period until it fails or balance became enough to process it. If the refund retrying process is timed out, the transaction will became failed with `refund_is_cancelled_by_system` status. This endpoint allows to cancel refund transaction manually if it has pending status. In this case the status it will be set to `refund_is_cancelled_by_initiator`.

get.description: Get operation info by external id and operation id
Get banks info which includes bank name and available periods

post.description:
Prepares the data about the specified payment of transaction and sends it into `callback_url` which was provided on the payment step.
If the `operation` field is not provided the callback will be sent for the last operation.

204.description: Payment successfully found and callback wes sent to the URL specified on the payment step

post.description: Creates alternative payment

Refund transaction after confirmation.

Common response statuses:
- Status: `success` Status Code: `refund_successful` - alternative payment installment was successfully refunded
- Status: `pending` Status Code: `pending` - wait for bank refund, final status will be set via callback
- Status: `failure` Status Code: any - depends on error

get.description: Get operation info by external id and operation id

post.description:
Prepares the data about the specified payment of transaction and sends it into `callback_url` which was provided on the payment step.
If the `operation` field is not provided the callback will be sent for the last operation.

204.description: Payment successfully found and callback wes sent to the URL specified on the payment step

post.description: Create a subscription plan.

get.description: Get a target plan by id.

post.description: Create subscription

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used if both are set.
There is a deprecated way to call the endpoint.
Please use access token with `authorization_flow=processing` instead if you need 
to do some non user-initiated action like background processing or calls from the admin.

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used if both are set.
There is a deprecated way to call the endpoint.
Please use access token with `authorization_flow=processing` instead if you need 
to do some non user-initiated action like background processing or calls from the admin.

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used if both are set.
There is a deprecated way to call the endpoint.
Please use access token with `authorization_flow=processing` instead if you need 
to do some non user-initiated action like background processing or calls from the admin.

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used if both are set.
There is a deprecated way to call the endpoint.
Please use access token with `authorization_flow=processing` instead if you need 
to do some non user-initiated action like background processing or calls from the admin.

post.description:
Temporary endpoint to create a gifted subscription.
The initial payment will be skipped for a gifted subscription and
subscription will become active immediately after the successful response.
In case the customer already has an active subscription for the
same plan - no gifted subscription will be created, error response
will be returned. Only recurrent_id payment option is supported.

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used first if both are set.
This is a suggested way of authorization for the current endpoint.

get.description: Return all payments of the target subscription.

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used if both are set.
There is a deprecated way to call the endpoint.
Please use access token with `authorization_flow=processing` instead if you need 
to do some non user-initiated action like background processing or calls from the admin.

delete.description: Cancel a target subscription with optional refund.

parameters.name: X-CUSTOMER-RID
parameters.description:
User RID identifier. RID header will be used if both are set.
There is a deprecated way to call the endpoint.
Please use access token with `authorization_flow=processing` instead if you need
to do some non user-initiated action like background processing or calls from the admin.

post.description:
Receive a report for a desired period with paid-out payments.
You can both receive payments only for current login or for all possible sources within single business.

Get detailed transactions report. Supports filtering by statuses and operation types.
Date range must not exceed 14 days and start date must not be more than 90 days in the past.

PaymentMode.description:
Describes the way of the integration:
- `hosted` - returns checkout page, where user can enter his payment details.
- `direct` - requires customer's payment details in request. Usually returns url for second factor (3DS or other).
- `express_checkout` - requires list of products in request. Returns checkout url.

callback_url.description:
URL where callback will be sent in case of successful or unsuccessful card confirmation

Required for `hosted` mode.

payment_method.description:
Based on your choice in the `type` field, one of the fields becomes required too.

Required for `direct` mode.

cc_token.description: Decoded information about tokenized card from card widget.

token.description: Card token received from widget or payment response

mask.description: Card mask received from widget or payment response

expires_at.description: Card expire date received from widget or payment response

use_3ds_flow.description:
Flag that indicates necessity of the 3ds confirmation.
The 3ds confirmation will be skipped if set `false`

encrypted_cc_token.description: Encoded string containing info returned by card widget.

data.description: Encoded string returned by card widget.

use_3ds_flow.description:
Flag that indicates necessity of the 3ds confirmation.
The 3ds confirmation will be skipped if set `false`

result_url.description: URL where user will be redirected from the checkout in case if mode set to `hosted`

make_default.description: Automatically set new payment method as default in wallet, if it was confirmed.

mode.description:
Describes the way of the integration:
- `hosted` - returns checkout page, where user can enter his payment details.
- `direct` - requires `payment_method` details in request. Usually returns url for second factor (3DS or other).

external_id.description: External ID of a payment, passed from your side on create.

products.description:
List of products for refund. 
Required in case of partial refund for projects with enabled fiscalization. 
For full refund products would be taken from create request.

external_id.description: External ID of a payment, passed from your side on create.
External ID of a payment, passed from your side on create.
External ID of a payment, passed from your side on create.

products.description:
List of confirmed products. 
Required in case of partial confirm for projects with enabled fiscalization. 
For full confirm products would be taken from create request.

result_url.description:
URL where the user will be redirected after the payment is completed. 
If the payment requires 3-D Secure, the user will be redirected to this URL after completing the 3DS flow. 
If `result_url` is not provided the user will be redirected to the URL configured in the project settings.

confirm.description:
If `true` - funds are transferred to recipient account.
If `false` - you have to call `POST /api/payments/v1/confirm` for additional confirmation of funds transfer.

external_id.description:
You can use `external_id` to link the corresponding payment within your system.
This could be order ID or any other logical identifier.
You can pass same external ID on every payment attempt until you receive success one.
At most one success payment is allowed with same external_id within single login. If such
condition occurs, request will complete with corresponding error.

checkout_ttl.description: Checkout TTL allows to configure how long the checkout will be available (in minutes).

result_url.description:
URL where the user will be redirected after the payment is completed. 
If the payment requires 3-D Secure, the user will be redirected to this URL after completing the 3DS flow. 
If `result_url` is not provided the user will be redirected to the URL configured in the project settings.

confirm.description:
If `true` - funds are transferred to recipient account.
If `false` - you have to call `POST /api/payments/v1/confirm` for additional confirmation of funds transfer.

external_id.description:
You can use `external_id` to link the corresponding payment within your system.
This could be order ID or any other logical identifier.
You can pass same external ID on every payment attempt until you receive success one.
At most one success payment is allowed with same external_id within single login. If such
condition occurs, request will complete with corresponding error.

checkout_ttl.description: Checkout TTL allows to configure how long the checkout will be available (in minutes).

callback_url.description: URL to receive callback after finalization of batch operation.

customer.description: Payer customer data. This field is required for `direct` payments.

payload.description: Additional data transmitted with the batch payment request. One parameter for the entire batch.

result_url.description:
URL where the user will be redirected after the payment is completed. 
If the payment requires 3-D Secure, the user will be redirected to this URL after completing the 3DS flow. 
If `result_url` is not provided the user will be redirected to the URL configured in the project settings.

confirm.description:
If `true` - funds are transferred to recipient account.
If `false` - you have to call `POST /api/payments/batch/v1/confirm` for additional confirmation of funds transfer.

batch_external_id.description:
External identifier from the merchant, one per batch.
Unique within the project.

checkout_ttl.description: Checkout TTL allows to configure how long the checkout will be available (in minutes). This feature is supported only for hosted mode.

payment_method.description:
Based on your choice in `type` field, one of the fields becomes required too.
This field is required for `direct` payments.

BatchPaymentMode.description:
Describes the way of the integration:
- `direct` - requires customer's payment details in request. Usually returns url for second factor (3DS or other).
- `hosted` - returns checkout page, where user can enter his payment details.

api_key.description: Api key from the project for which the order is placed.

external_id.description: The external ID of order.

products.description: An array of product objects that are added to the order.

amount.description: The amount of actual write-off of funds.

auth_code.description: Transaction authorization code (provided by the bank or gateway).

created_at.description: Date and time the transaction was created.

payload.description: Additional data transmitted with the batch payment request. One parameter for the entire batch.

processed_at.description: The date and time the transaction was processed.

terminal_name.description: The name of the terminal through which the payment was made.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank through which the payment was made.

external_id.description: External transaction identifier.

callback_url.description: URL to receive callback after finalization of batch operation.

payload.description:
Additional data transmitted with the batch payment confirmation request.
One parameter for the entire confirmation request.

orders.description: List of orders in batch to confirm.

batch_external_id.description: External identifier from the merchant. Ought to be the same as during batch creation.

api_key.description: Api key from the project for which the order is placed.

amount.description: Confirmation amount. If the amount is not set, full confirmation will be processed for this order.

external_id.description: The external ID of order.

callback_url.description: URL to receive callback after finalization of batch operation.

payload.description:
Additional data transmitted with the batch payment cancellation request.
One parameter for the entire cancellation request.

batch_external_id.description: External identifier from the merchant. Ought to be the same as during batch creation.

delegate_api_key.description: If a `delegate_api_key` is provided, the recurrent payment will be processed in favor of the `delegate_api_key` owner using the payment data from the initial payment.

confirm.description:
If `true` - funds are transferred to recipient account.
If `false` - you have to call `POST /api/payments/v1/confirm` for additional confirmation of funds transfer.

tax_group.description:
Tax group is required for projects with enabled fiscalization.
- 1: ПДВ 20%
- 2: Без ПДВ
- 3: ПДВ 20% + акциз 5%
- 4: ПДВ 7%
- 5: ПДВ 0%
- 6: Без ПДВ + акциз 5%
- 7: Не є об`єктом ПДВ
- 8: ПДВ 20% + ПФ 7.5%
- 9: ПДВ 14%

CustomerRequestPaymentMethod.description: Based on your choice in `type` field, one of the fields becomes required too.

RecipientRequestPaymentMethod.description: Based on your choice in `type` field, one of the fields becomes required too.

country.description: Two-letter country code in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format

external_id.description: User ID in external system

method.description: Method name called on payment flow provider side.

value.description: Action value. Usually it's a checkout url or 3ds verification url.

UserAction.description: Object which contains information about required post-request action. Will be null if action not required.

option_id.description: `id` of added card. Can be used for payments with `wallet` payment type.

name.description: Optional card name set by user.

external_id.description: User identifier on your platform

CustomerCheckoutLocale.description: Locale of checkout for the `hosted` payment mode

CheckoutColorMode.description: Color theme of checkout for the `hosted` payment mode

created_at.description:
Plan creation date-time in RFC3339 format.
Time is returned in UTC timezone.
Immutable.

end_date.description: Optional end date for the plan in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

frequency.description:
The number of frequency_types in a single plan payment period.
For example, to set a plan payment period for 4 weeks use frequency=4 and frequency_type=weekly.

duration_periods.description:
The number of frequency_types in a plan duration period.
For example, to set a plan duration period for 6 months use
frequency=1, frequency_type=monthly, duration_periods=6.

platforms.description: A list of other platforms that can access this plan.

price.description:
Plan price in main currency units.
For example, value of 30 equals 30 UAH plan price.

start_date.description: Plan start date-time in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

updated_at.description:
Last date-time of plan data update in RFC3339 format.
Time is specified in UTC timezone.

PlanFrequencyType.description:
The time interval type of a plan period.
For example, to set a plan period for 4 weeks use frequency=4 and frequency_type=weekly.

price.description:
Plan price in main currency units.
For example, value of 30 equals 30 UAH plan price.

callbacks.description: A list of api keys and URLs for subscription update callbacks.

platforms.description: A list of other platforms that can access this plan.

frequency.description:
The number of frequency_types in a single plan payment period.
For example, to set a plan payment period for 4 weeks use frequency=4 and frequency_type=weekly.

duration_periods.description:
The number of frequency_types in a plan duration period.
For example, to set a plan duration period for 6 months use
frequency=1, frequency_type=monthly, duration_periods=6.

start_date.description: Plan start date-time in RFC3339 format.

end_date.description: Optional end date-time for the plan in RFC3339 format.

callbacks.description:
New list of api keys and URLs for subscription update callbacks.
Overrides currently stored list.

auto_renew.description:
Controls whether the subscription should automatically
renew after the due date.

auto_renew_locked_until.description:
The next date-time when the subscription auto_renew param can be changed.
The value is calculated based on duration_periods param of the corresponding
subscription plan.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format.
Time is specified in UTC timezone.

callback_url.description: The URL where asynchronous subscription updates will be sent.

created_at.description:
Subscription creation date-time in RFC3339 format.
Time is returned in UTC timezone.
Immutable.

customer_id.description: Customer identifier. May hold RID value.

delegate_api_key.description: Project API key where recurrent payments are delegated.

due_date.description:
The date until which subscription will stay active if not cancelled.
Date is returned in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

external_id.description: Identifier to link the subscription within partner system. Currently used by Rozetka only.

external_premium_id.description: Identifier to link the subscription within partner system. Currently used by Rozetka only.

is_retrying.description: Shows whether the subscription in currently retrying its renew payment.

next_notification_date.description:
The date of next notification for the customer.
Date is returned in RFC3339 format.
Currently not supported.

next_payment_date.description:
The date of next payment for the subscription.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

price.description:
Subscription price in main currency units.
For example, value of 30 equals 30 UAH subscription price.

project_id.description: Source project for the current subscription.

recurrent_id.description:
The recurrent id for the subscription payments.
Optional.

result_url.description: The URL where user will be redirected after successful payment.

start_date.description:
The start date of the subscription.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

time_of_day.description:
The time of day component for the params that have date specified only.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format.

trial_periods.description: The amount of trial periods assigned to the subscription.

trial_periodic_payments.description:
Specifies, whether to apply periodic payments for trial subscription
instead of single initial payment in case trial_periods value is more than one.

trial_until.description:
The end date-time of the subscription trial.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format.
Time is specified in UTC timezone.

unified_external_id.description: Identifier to link the subscription within partner system. Currently used by Rozetka only.

updated_at.description:
The last date-time of the subscription update.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format.

use_plan_price_on_auto_renew.description:
Controls whether the subscription should use the plan price
instead the of the price provided in subscription data when the
automatic subscription renew is performed.

gifted.description: A marker that indicates whether the subscription is currently a gift subscription.

gifted_from.description:
The start date of the gift subscription.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

gifted_until.description:
The end date of the gift subscription.
Date-time is returned in RFC3339 format, time is omitted.

gifted_unified_external_id.description: Identifier to link the gifted subscription within partner system.

amount.description:
Payment amount in main currency units.
For example, value of 30 equals 30 UAH payment amount.

created_at.description:
Payment creation date-time in RFC3339 format.
Time is returned in UTC timezone.
Immutable.

transaction_id.description: Unique transaction id for payment (null for a gifted subscription or failed payment operation)

next_processing_date.description:
Date-time of next payment processing attempt in RFC3339 format.
Time is returned in UTC timezone.

processed_at.description:
Date-time of payment processing completion in RFC3339 format.
Time is returned in UTC timezone.

retry_count.description: The count of payment retries performed after failed first attempt.

updated_at.description:
Last date-time of payment data update in RFC3339 format.
Time is returned in UTC timezone.

Controls whether the subscription should automatically
renew after the due date.

callback_url.description: The URL where asynchronous subscription updates will be sent.

delegate_api_key.description: Project API key to delegate recurrent payments to.

The start date of the subscription.
Date-time should be specified in RFC3339 format, UTC timezone.

trial_periods.description: The amount of trial periods assigned to the subscription.

Subscription price in main currency units.
For example, value of 30 equals 30 UAH subscription price.
In case the price is not specified or has value of 0, plan price will be used instead.

Controls whether the subscription should use the plan price
instead the of the price provided in subscription data when the
automatic subscription renew is performed.

Controls whether the subscription should automatically
renew after the due date.

New end date of the gift period.
The date cannot be earlier than tomorrow's date and
less than the start date of the gift period.
Cannot update if subscription hasn't gifted_from date.

SubscriptionCallbackType.description:
Callback events:
- `payment.processed` - the initial or renew payment for the subscription has been successfully processed, 
  subscription has switched to the active state.
  For the initial payment the *subscription.start_date* param is on the same date with the *payment.processed_at*.
  For the renew payment the *subscription.start_date* param is on the prior date relative to *payment.processed_at*.
  The *subscription* callback field holds the subscription state prior to the successful payment.
- `payment.failed` - the initial or renew payment has failed. The rules of determining the initial or renew 
  payment is the same as for the `payment.processed` event type. Initial subscription payment failure is final, 
  it permanently switches the corresponding subscription to the inactive state. Instead, the renew payments 
  do a retry attempt once a day for 3 days after *next_payment_date*. During the renew payment retries
  *subscription.is_retrying* param is set to *true*. 
  After 3 failed renew payment attempts the subscription is deactivated. 
- `subscription.deactivated` - the subscription has been deactivated. The reason for deactivation can be either the
   disabled *auto_renew* param at the time of *next_payment_date* or when the all 3 renew payment attempts have failed.
- `subscription.renewed` - a subscription started a new billing cycle after the successfull renew payment.
  The *subscription* callback field holds the subscription state after the successful payment.
- `subscription.cancelled` - a subscription was cancelled manually by support.
- `subscription.refunded` - the last payment for a subscription was refunded after subscription was cancelled.
  The event is sent only when the subscription was previously cancelled with the refund option enabled.
- `subscription.refund_failed` - Refund was failed because of these reasons: 
  - refund period is expired
  - daily limit on refunds was exceeded in a bank
  - incorrect refund sum or currency
- `subscription.customer_id_updated` - reassign subscriptions to another customer_id.
- `subscription.updated` - changing subscription details. At present, the following fields can be changed:
  - gifted
  - next_payment_date
  - due_date
  - trial_periods
  - trial_until
  - auto_renew.

PayPartsPaymentMode.description:
Describes the way of the integration:
- `hosted` - returns checkout page, where user can enter his payment details.
- `direct` - requires customer's payment details in request. Usually returns url for second factor (3DS or other).

external_id.description: Id of the product on the merchant side.

tax_group.description:
Tax group is required for projects with enabled fiscalization.
- 1: ПДВ 20%
- 2: Без ПДВ
- 3: ПДВ 20% + акциз 5%
- 4: ПДВ 7%
- 5: ПДВ 0%
- 6: Без ПДВ + акциз 5%
- 7: Не є об`єктом ПДВ
- 8: ПДВ 20% + ПФ 7.5%
- 9: ПДВ 14%

phone.description:
Phone number has to be in the following format ('+' is required): +38XXXXXXXXXX
Requirement of the phone number per bank:
| Bank | Required |
| --- | --- |
| `privatbank` | `no` |
| `oschadbank` | `no` |
| `abank` | `yes` |
| `monobank` | `yes` |
| `izibank` | `yes` |
| `rozetka` | `yes` |

products.description:
List of products for refund. 
Required in case of partial refund for projects with enabled fiscalization. 
For full refund products would be taken from create request.

auto_confirm_after_success.description:
If set to `true`, order confirmation will be done automatically after creation becomes successful
(contract was signed on client side).
If set to `false`, you should call the confirm endpoint manually to perform order confirmation
after successful creation.

parts_count.description:
Every bank supports different ranges of parts count. Check this values by using the
[Get banks info](#tag/payparts/operation/payPartsGetBanksInfo) endpoint.

description.description: Order description can have from 1 to 256 characters.

result_url.description: Maximum length is about 2048 characters. Required for bank_name = rozetkapay.

PayPartsResponseCode.description:
Possible status codes grouped by status:
| Status | Status Code | Description |
|---|---|---|
| success | transaction_successful | Transaction successful. |
| success | contract_was_signed_on_client_side | The contract was signed on the client side. |
| success | refund_successful | Refund successful. |
| pending | pending | Pending. |
| failure | failed_to_create_transaction | Failed to create transaction. |
| failure | internal_error | Internal error. |
| failure | transaction_not_found | Transaction not found. |
| failure | wrong_cooperation_type | Wrong cooperation type. |
| failure | transaction_rejected | Transaction rejected. |
| pending | waiting_for_redirect | Waiting for redirect. |
| pending | confirmation_required | Confirmation required. |
| failure | order_expired | Order expired. |
| failure | transaction_declined | Transaction declined. |
| failure | user_not_found | User not found. |
| failure | insufficient_funds | Insufficient funds. |
| failure | transaction_is_canceled_by_payer | Transaction is canceled by payer. |
| failure | transaction_limit_exceeded | Transaction limit exceeded. |
| failure | transaction_not_supported | Transaction not supported. |
| failure | wrong_payment_count | Wrong number of payment count. |
| failure | wrong_installment_period | Wrong installment period. |
| failure | banking_application_is_not_installed | Banking application is not installed. |
| failure | bank_is_not_supported | The bank is not supported. |
| failure | invalid_phone_number | Invalid phone number. |
| failure | simultaneous_open_orders_not_supported_by_bank | Simultaneous open orders are not supported by the bank. |
| failure | transaction_amount_limit | Transaction amount limit. |
| failure | finmon_validation_failed | Finmon validation failed. |
| failure | insufficient_funds_for_refund | Insufficient funds on account for refund. |

limits.description: Upper and lower limits of order amount for bank in UAH.

min_amount.description: If absent, the minimum amount equals to minimum required amount in create order operation.

max_amount.description: If absent, there is not any upper limit.

fields.description:
By default, all available fields are returned.
See response schema for available field names.

scope.description: Regulate how many data you would like to receive.

date_from.description:
Start date of the period.
Must not be more than 90 days in the past.

date_to.description:
End date of the period.
Must not exceed 14 days from start date.

operation_types.description: By default, all available operation types are returned.

statuses.description: By default, all available statuses are returned.

number.description: Full card number. Required if `token` is empty

token.description: Card token received from payment operation. Required if `number` is empty

AlternativePaymentProvider.description: Available providers where the payment can be created.

type.description: The field is required if provider value (from request root) is one of the following: `imoje`, `leaselink`.

description.description: Order description can have from 1 to 256 characters.

products.description: Products are required if provider value is one of the following: `santander`.

FiscalizationStatusCode.description:
Fiscalization status code
- 1000: Test result
- 1001: Operation successful
- 1002: Operation in progress
- 2001: Invalid fiscalization data. Please verify product information
- 2002: Internal error. Please contact support
- 2003: Not authorized. Please check your permissions
- 2004: Temporary failure. Please try again later
- 2005: Fiscalization service temporarily unavailable
- 2006: Not authorized. Please verify your token
- 3001: Required data not found
- 3002: Duplicate attempt detected
- 4001: Cash register not activated in tax system
- 4002: Cash register blocked. Please contact support
- 4003: Cash register data conflict detected. Please try again later
- 4004: Cash register processing another operation. Please try again later
- 4005: Cannot change cash register operating mode
- 4006: Cash register locked by another application. Please close all other fiscal software
- 4050: Fiscal shift not opened. Please open a shift in your cash register before processing transactions
- 4051: Fiscal shift is not closed. Please close the current shift
- 5001: Electronic signature key not registered with tax authorities. Please register your EDS key in the tax system before enabling fiscalization
- 5002: Electronic signature key has been revoked. Please obtain and register a new EDS certificate
- 5003: Electronic signature verification failed. Please check your EDS key validity and permissions
- 6001: Tax authority service error. Please contact support
- 6002: Tax authority service unavailable. Please try again later
- 6003: Tax authority response timeout. Please try again later
- 7001: Fiscal receipt validation failed. Receipt sequence broken. Please contact support
- 7002: Fiscal receipt generation failed. Please contact support

action_required.description: Flag that indicates necessity of the post-request action (fill data on the checkout, 3ds confirmation, etc.)

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

batch_external_id.description:
External identifier from the merchant, one per batch.
Unique within the project.
The parameter is used for the batch payment logic.

action_required.description: A flag indicating that user action is required.

batch_external_id.description: External identifier from the merchant, one per batch. Unique within the project.

receipt_url.description: URL to the received receipt or transaction confirmation.

action_required.description: A boolean flag which indicates if action from the customer is required

amount_confirmed.description: Amount of confirmed funds in the 2-step acquiring flow

canceled.description: A boolean flag which indicates if payment was canceled

confirmation_details.description: List of confirmation transactions in the 2-step acquiring flow

confirmed.description: A boolean flag for the 2-step acquiring flow which indicates if payment was confirmed

external_id.description: Merchant's transaction id

batch_external_id.description:
External identifier from the merchant, one per batch.
Unique within the project.
The parameter is used for the batch payment logic.

purchased.description: A boolean flag which indicates if payment was successful

receipt_url.description: Link to the receipt for user

refunded.description: A boolean flag which indicates if payment was refunded

external_id.description: External id

action_required.description: A boolean flag which indicates if action from the customer is required

receipt_url.description: Link to the receipt for user

external_id.description: Merchant's transaction id

amount_confirmed.description: Amount of confirmed funds. The value has to be same as amount.

amount_canceled.description: Amount of canceled funds. The value has to be same as amount.

purchased.description: A boolean flag which indicates if payment was successful

confirmed.description: A boolean flag which indicates if order was confirmed

refunded.description: A boolean flag which indicates if order was refunded

canceled.description: A boolean flag which indicates if order was canceled

receipt_url.description: Link to the receipt for user

action_required.description: A boolean flag which indicates if action from the customer is required

option_id.description: `id` of added card. Can be used for payments with `wallet` payment type.

available_amount.description:
Amount on merchant's balance available for payouts.
If it becomes too low, merchant is no longer able to [create payout](#tag/payouts/operation/createPayout).

commitment_amount.description:
Amount on merchant's balance which was already reserved for payout but not yet used.
This amount becomes positive when payout in cash is requested but not completed 
(e.g. customer left a request to return goods but haven't come to point of purchase yet).

external_id.description: External id
Merchant's transaction id

purchased.description: A boolean flag which indicates if payment was successful

refunded.description: A boolean flag which indicates if order was refunded

BasicAuth.description:
Basic Auth consists of login and password combined into a header field in the following form:
```
Authorization: Basic <credentials>
```
where `<credentials>` is the Base64 encoding of login and password joined by a single colon `:`.

You should be provided with login and password by our support team.
Otherwise, if you have already been using other RozetkaPay online payments API,
you can reuse previously provided `API_KEY` and `API_SECRET` for `X-API-AUTH` header
as login and password respectively to authorize into API Gateway.

customerAuth.description:
User's personal access token allows to find or/and authorize user in
- customer's wallet
- subscriptions
- other parts of the API Gateway

You can also see the X-CUSTOMER-RID header. Is a DEPRECATED way to use endpoints with a raw rid
for not user-initiated actions like calls from admin panel or background processing.
Please, use X-CUSTOMER-AUTH with a special type of access token (authorization_flow = processing) instead.

If you need additional details about "processing" access token, please ask details in RozetkaPay ID Team.
customerAuth.name: X-CUSTOMER-AUTH

onBehalfOf.description: Used for partnership mode, when one core account operates with several children
onBehalfOf.name: X-ON-BEHALF-OF

parameters.name: X-ROZETKAPAY-SIGNATURE
parameters.description:
With this header, you can verify if the callback is from RozetkaPay.

Calculation algorithm:
```
signature=base64url_encode(sha1($password + base64url_encode($json_body) + $password))
```

post.description: Return transaction data if payment was processed successfully or occurred the business error

200.description: Shows that callback was accepted. No further callback after this response.

post.description:
Returns status of operation after accepting/rejecting on the 3ds page.
Callback won't be sent in case when original request returned `success` or `failure` status

200.description: Shows that callback was accepted. No further callback after this response.

parameters.name: X-ROZETKAPAY-SIGNATURE
parameters.description:
With this header, you can verify if the callback is from RozetkaPay.

Calculation algorithm:
```
signature=base64url_encode(sha1($password + base64url_encode($json_body) + $password))
```

post.description: Return operations data if order was processed successfully or occurred the business error

200.description: Shows that callback was accepted. No further callback after this response.

post.description:
HTTP call with subscription and payment data is performed when subscription is updated.
When an event isn't related to a payment, the payment field may be omitted.

200.description: Shows that callback was accepted. No further callback after this response.

parameters.name: X-ROZETKAPAY-SIGNATURE
parameters.description:
With this header, you can verify if the callback is from RozetkaPay.

Calculation algorithm:
```
signature=base64url_encode(sha1($password + base64url_encode($json_body) + $password))
```

post.description: Payout result.
